alert.note: Alert for Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 21 at 2:21AM MST until March 21 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow above 7000 feet, with a rain and snow mix from 6500 to 7000 feet. Snow levels rising above 7500 feet this afternoon and this evening. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Rain and snow changing back to all snow above 6500 to 7000 feet later tonight and early Wednesday. Watch for additional statements regarding the snow on Wednesday. * WHERE...Areas above 7000 feet near Flagstaff. * WHEN...From midnight MST tonight to 2 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 2 PM Today: Flagstaff 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
